titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1213) to repeal mandatory funding provided to States in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to establish American Health Benefit Exchanges, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1214) to repeal mandatory funding for school-based health center construction.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 112-70, by Mr. Reed.

All points of order against provisions in the bills are waived. In the case of H.R. 1214, the resolution makes in order only those amendments that are received for printing in the portion of the Congressional Record designated for that purpose in clause 8 of rule XVIII in a daily issue dated May 2, 2011, and pro forma amendments for the purpose of debate. In the case of H.R. 1214, the resolution makes in order only those amendments that are received for printing in the portion of the Congressional Record designated for that purpose in clause 8 of rule XVIII in a daily issue dated May 2, 2011, and pro forma amendments for the purpose of debate.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 32.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 236.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 234 - 185 (Roll no. 279).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 237 - 185 (Roll no. 280).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/2/2011--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1213) to repeal mandatory funding provided to States in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to establish American Health Benefit Exchanges, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1214) to repeal mandatory funding for school-based health center construction.
